column4: is there any way to run "locate <file name>" and also have it delete what it locates?
yeah with pipes
xborgy- fill me in,i have no clue what that is.
do locate blah | rm
rm = the remove cmd
xborgy- right,didn't know what "pipes" was.thanks!
pipes is | to string long cmd's together
xborgy- so if i wanted to delete every wine-related file/dir i would do "locate wine | rm"?
nope
are you saying you just want to remove wine all together or the programs you installed inside of wine?
Flannel- and that deletes everything and everything of wine?
xborgy- thanks.
yeah so if you wanted to just uninstall apps inside of wine just type in a terminal uninstaller
Flannel- i ran a "locate wine" after that and there are still a bunch of files/dirs showing up.
Flannel- i installed it via "apt-get install wine"
Flannel- and there were a couple of apps that would just not delete.
Flannel- or uninstall.
Flannel- they were still showing up as installed.
and they would run when clicked.
I also recomend you to delete unneded pathlinks in /etc/ld.so.conf /usr/lib32 /usr/X11R6/lib32 /lib32
they are no longer needed now you uninstalled WINE, this makes your Ubuntubox more secure or so..
Flannel- nope,nothing other than install them.
Flannel- it's saying wine is not even installed.
try sudo apt-get autoremove wine
